serial_reader_l3.c File Reference

Mercury API - serial reader low level implementation. More...

Detailed Description

Mercury API - serial reader low level implementation.

Author:
Nathan Williams
Date:
11/2/2009

TMR_SR_ReaderStatisticsFlag  statFlags,
TMR_SR_ReaderStatistics *  stats 
)

TMR_SR_cmdGetReaderStatistics Get the current per-port statistics.

Parameters:
reader [in]The reader
statFlags [in]The set of statistics together
stats [out]The ReaderStatistics structure populated with requested per-port values

TMR_Status TMR_SR_cmdHiggs2FullLoadImage ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint16_t  timeout,
TMR_GEN2_Password  accessPassword,
TMR_GEN2_Password  killPassword,
uint16_t  lockBits,
uint16_t  pcWord,
uint8_t  len,
const uint8_t  epc[],
TMR_TagFilter *  target 
)

Full Load Image (only 96-bit EPC with no user memory versions) Chip type = 0x01

Parameters:
reader The reader
timeout The timeout of the operation, in milliseconds. Valid range is 0-65535.
accessPassword The access password to write on the tag
killPassword The kill password to write on the tag
lockBits locking the tag according to the Alien Higgs LockBits
pcWord PC Word in the Tag EPC memBank defined in the Gen2 Specification
len Length of the EPC
epc The EPC to write to the tag. Maximum of 12 bytes (96 bits)
target Filter to be applied.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_cmdHiggs2PartialLoadImage ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint16_t  timeout,
TMR_GEN2_Password  accessPassword,
TMR_GEN2_Password  killPassword,
uint8_t  len,
const uint8_t  epc[],
TMR_TagFilter *  target 
)

Partial Load Image (only 96-bit EPC with no user memory versions) Chip type = 0x01

Parameters:
reader The reader
timeout The timeout of the operation, in milliseconds. Valid range is 0-65535.
accessPassword The access password to write on the tag
killPassword The kill password to write on the tag
len Length of the EPC
epc The EPC to write to the tag. Maximum of 12 bytes (96 bits)
target Filter to be applied.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_cmdHiggs3BlockReadLock ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint16_t  timeout,
TMR_GEN2_Password  accessPassword,
uint8_t  lockBits,
TMR_TagFilter *  target 
)

Higgs3 Block Read Lock Chip type = 0x05

Parameters:
reader The reader
timeout The timeout of the operation, in milliseconds. Valid range is 0-65535.
accessPassword The access password to use to write on the tag
lockBits A bitmask of bits to lock. Valid range 0-255
target Filter to be applied.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_cmdHiggs3FastLoadImage ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint16_t  timeout,
TMR_GEN2_Password  currentAccessPassword,

TMR_GEN2_Password  killPassword,
uint16_t  pcWord,

const uint8_t  epc[],
TMR_TagFilter *  target 
)

Higgs3 Fast Load Image (only 96-bit EPC) Chip type = 0x05

Parameters:
reader The reader
timeout The timeout of the operation, in milliseconds. Valid range is 0-65535.
currentAccessPassword The access password to use to write to the tag
accessPassword The access password to write on the tag
killPassword The kill password to write on the tag
pcWord PC Word in the Tag EPC memBank defined in the Gen2 Specification
len Length of the EPC
epc The EPC to write to the tag. Maximum of 12 bytes (96 bits)
target Filter to be applied.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_cmdHiggs3LoadImage ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint16_t  timeout,
TMR_GEN2_Password  currentAccessPassword,
TMR_GEN2_Password  accessPassword,
TMR_GEN2_Password  killPassword,
uint16_t  pcWord,
uint8_t  len,
const uint8_t  epcAndUserData[],
TMR_TagFilter *  target 
)

Higgs3 Load Image Chip type = 0x05

Parameters:
reader The reader
timeout The timeout of the operation, in milliseconds. Valid range is 0-65535.
currentAccessPassword The access password to use to write to the tag
accessPassword The access password to write on the tag
killPassword The kill password to write on the tag
pcWord PC Word in the Tag EPC memBank defined in the Gen2 Specification
len Length of epcAndUserData
epcAndUserData The EPC and user data to write to the tag. Must be exactly 76 bytes. The pcWord specifies which of this is EPC and which is user data.
target Filter to be applied.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_cmdMonza4QTReadWrite ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint16_t  timeout,
TMR_GEN2_Password  accessPassword,
TMR_Monza4_ControlByte  controlByte,
TMR_Monza4_Payload  payload,
TMR_uint8List *  data,
TMR_TagFilter *  target 
)

Impinj Monza4 QT Read/Write Chip type = 0x08, command = 0x00

Parameters:
reader The reader
timeout The timeout of the operation, in milliseconds. Valid range is 0-65535.
accessPassword The access password to use to write on the tag
controlByte The control byte to write on the tag
payload The payload
data If the operation is success, this data contains the payload When Read/Write (bit) = 0, then the payload is the value read, When Read/Write (bit) = 1, then the payload is the value written.
target Filter to be applied.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_cmdNxpCalibrate ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint16_t  timeout,
TMR_SR_GEN2_SiliconType  chip,
TMR_GEN2_Password  accessPassword,
TMR_uint8List *  data,
TMR_TagFilter *  target 
)

NXP Calibrate (only for G2xL) Chip type = 0x02, Command = 0x05

Parameters:
reader The reader
timeout The timeout of the operation, in milliseconds. Valid range is 0-65535.
chip The NXP Chip type (G2iL or G2xL)
accessPassword The access password to use to write on the tag
data 64 bytes of calibration data will be returned on a successful operation
target Filter to be applied.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_cmdNxpChangeConfig ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint16_t  timeout,
TMR_SR_GEN2_SiliconType  chip,
TMR_GEN2_Password  accessPassword,
TMR_NXP_ConfigWord  configWord,
TMR_uint8List *  data,
TMR_TagFilter *  target 
)

NXP ChangeConfig (only for G2iL) Chip type = 0x07, Command = 0x07

Parameters:
reader The reader
timeout The timeout of the operation, in milliseconds. Valid range is 0-65535.
chip The NXP Chip type (G2iL or G2xL)
accessPassword The access password to use to write on the tag
configWord (I/O)The config word to write on the tag.
data If the operation is success, this data contains the current configword setting on the tag.
target Filter to be applied.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_cmdNxpChangeEas ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint16_t  timeout,
TMR_SR_GEN2_SiliconType  chip,
TMR_GEN2_Password  accessPassword,
bool  reset,
TMR_TagFilter *  target 
)

NXP Change EAS Chip type = 0x02 or 0x07, Command = 0x03

Parameters:
reader The reader
timeout The timeout of the operation, in milliseconds. Valid range is 0-65535.
chip The NXP Chip type (G2iL or G2xL)
accessPassword The access password to use to write on the tag
reset Reset or set EAS bit
target Filter to be applied.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_cmdNxpEasAlarm ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint16_t  timeout,
TMR_SR_GEN2_SiliconType  chip,
TMR_GEN2_DivideRatio  dr,
TMR_GEN2_TagEncoding  m,
TMR_GEN2_TrExt  trExt,
TMR_uint8List *  data,
TMR_TagFilter *  target 
)

NXP EAS Alarm Chip type = 0x02 or 0x07, Command = 0x04

Parameters:
reader The reader
timeout The timeout of the operation, in milliseconds. Valid range is 0-65535.
chip The NXP Chip type (G2iL or G2xL)
dr Gen2 divide ratio to use
m Gen2 M(tag encoding) parameter to use
trExt Gen2 TrExt value to use
data 8 bytes of EAS alarm data will be returned, on successful operation
target Filter to be applied.

TMR_SR_ReaderStatisticsFlag  statFlags 
)

TMR_SR_cmdResetReaderStatistics Reset the per-port statistics.

Parameters:
reader [in]The reader
statFlags [in]The set of statistics to reset. Only the RF on time statistic may be reset.

)

Parameters:

key_len Length of license key or the key array

TMR_SR_UserConfigOperation  op,
TMR_SR_UserConfigCategory  category,
TMR_SR_UserConfigType  type 
)

Setting user profile on the basis of operation, category and type parameter

Parameters:
reader The reader
op operation to be performed on configuration (Save,restore,verify and reset)
category Which category of configuration to operate on -- only TMR_SR_ALL is currently supported
type Type of configuration value to use (default, custom...)

bool  on 
)

Turn CW transmission on or off. Testing command.

Parameters:
reader The reader
on whether to turn CW on or off

uint16_t  duration 
)

Turn on pseudo-random bit stream transmission for a particular duration. Testing command.

Parameters:

duration the duration to transmit the PRBS signal.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_receiveMessage ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint8_t *  data,
uint8_t  opcode,
uint32_t  timeoutMs 
)

Receive a response.

Parameters:
reader The reader
[in] data Message to send, with length in byte 1. Byte 0 is reserved for the SOF character, and two characters at the end are reserved for the CRC.
[out] data Message received.
opcode Opcode that was sent with message that elicited this response, to be matched against incoming response opcode.
timeoutMs Timeout value.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_sendBytes ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint8_t  len,
uint8_t *  data,
uint32_t  timeoutMs 
)

Send a byte string

Parameters:
reader The reader
[in] len Number of bytes to send
[in] data Bytes to send, with length in byte 1. Byte 0 is reserved for the SOF character, and two characters at the end are reserved for the CRC.
timeoutMs Timeout value.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_sendMessage ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint8_t *  data,
uint8_t *  opcode,
uint32_t  timeoutMs 
)

Send a message to the reader

Parameters:
reader The reader
[in] data Message to send, with length in byte 1. Byte 0 is reserved for the SOF character, and two characters at the end are reserved for the CRC.
[out] opcode Opcode sent with message (pass this value to receiveMessage to match against response)
timeoutMs Timeout value.

TMR_Status TMR_SR_sendTimeout ( TMR_Reader *  reader,
uint8_t *  data,
uint32_t  timeoutMs 
)

Send a message and receive a response.

Parameters:
reader The reader
[in] data Message to send, with length in byte 1. Byte 0 is reserved for the SOF character, and two characters at the end are reserved for the CRC.
[out] data Message received.
timeoutMs Timeout value.
